snippet: The Manhattan district attorney’s office plans to launch a pilot program in September that will use the GPS in smartphones to track defendants awaiting trial, which may help prevent them from being sent to Rikers Island.
abstract: Manhattan district attorney's office is set to launch pilot program that would track young people accused of felonies with GPS technology in smartphones and electronic bracelets rather than keeping them in jail as they await trial; program aims to reduce number of teenagers held at Rikers Island for long periods of time and attendant psychological distress.
lead_paragraph: The Manhattan district attorney’s office plans to launch a pilot program in September that will use the GPS in smartphones to track defendants awaiting trial, which may help prevent them from being sent to Rikers Island.

headline.main: New Monitoring Program Aims to Keep Youths Out of Rikers Island
headline.print_headline: New Monitoring Program Aims to Keep Youths Out of Rikers
